summary: A letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Deutsche Bank's third production of documents in response to a grand jury subpoena concerning Epstein-affiliated accounts. The production includes KYC records, account opening documentation, and transaction records.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch and its affiliates, requesting documents related to Epstein-affiliated accounts.

events.title: Third Document Production to Grand Jury
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its attorneys, submitted its third rolling production of documents in response to the grand jury subpoena, including KYC records and account documentation.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was subject to a grand jury subpoena dated July 11, 2019, investigating Epstein-affiliated accounts.

The bank's third production included KYC records (DB-SDNY-0000479 through 0000504) and documents related to Epstein-affiliated accounts such as account opening documentation, signature cards, ID copies, transaction records, and ISDA agreements (DB-SDNY-0000505 through 0001288).
The production was made under confidentiality protections of Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e) and the bank reserved all applicable privileges.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing, cooperative investigation between Deutsche Bank's legal counsel and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The document reveals the scope of financial records being examined, including Know Your Customer (KYC) records and transactional documents.
